refresher.content:
# Your Final Challenge

You are now the lead developer of a hospital management system. Your app must support:

- Patient management (admit, discharge, update status)
- Doctor and nurse dashboards
- Wards, departments, and multiple floors
- Protected routes for roles (admin, doctor, nurse)
- Real-time updates and notifications
- Lazy-loaded dashboards for performance
- Error handling for robust UX
- Testing for critical workflows

Think of this as your **capstone project** â€” combining **all lessons into a real app**.

task.description: Implement a full hospital management system using React Gym concepts.
requirements: Use Context API and custom hooks for state management
Use Portals for modals and notifications
Implement Suspense + lazy for performance optimization
Implement memoization to prevent unnecessary re-renders
Write tests for PatientList and dashboards
Handle errors gracefully with Error Boundaries
task.solution: /* Final solution will be a full React app following the structure above */
hints: Break app into small, testable components
Lazy-load heavy dashboards and patient lists
Wrap modals and notifications in Portals
Use Context API for authentication and patient state
Use Suspense fallback UI for async data
Optimize performance with React.memo, useCallback, and useMemo
tests: Patient management works correctly (admit, update, discharge)
Lazy-loaded components display fallback loader initially
Modals and notifications render in portal
Error boundaries catch exceptions without crashing app
Responsive design works on multiple screen sizes
